Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with top of foot; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two added white bands; below, in centre of bowl, part of rosette with alternating added red and white petals within two white bands; exterior: part of double guilloche pattern in handle zone above wide band between two lines; below, rays and dark area at join with foot.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Wild Goat Style. Whilst the exterior decoration is typical of that style, the presence of the interior decoration suggests that it may belong to the later part of that style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 49 note 100, p. 234, no. 137)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0389) (phase 2)
